body:
That sounds about right :-)
Currently, the `AbstractSender` uses a disposition handler (`AbstractSender.setDispositionHandler`) at the instance level which doesn't seem to make sense to me because disposition handling should be done at the message level. So, I guess you are right in that we should provide variants of the `send` methods allowing to pass in a disposition handler. WDYT?

@francois-travais MQTT protocol don't have any mechanism with which we can reject that QoS 1 message, so our options would be to try resend it or disconnect. Other stuff looks good so far. It'd be good to create a PR with, to make it easier to review and collaborate on the solution
Sorry for the fail PRs, I forgot to sign my commits and sign Eclipse license agreement.
@francois-travais Hi Francois, does this work now for you? If so, can you please close the issue?
@francois-travais feel free to re-open if this doesn't work for you.

Yes sure. It worked for me. But I think another part wasn't working as I expected: if I recall correctly hono server acknowledge the message sent by the adapter before it is received by the southbound application or the broker.
